The crew intercepts a message from a previous ship, which disappeared - but the unexpected contact sets off a dangerous chain of events. Danny Boyle's sci-fi thriller, starring Cillian Murphy, Chris Evans, Michelle Yeoh and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Project: ALF
programme.desc: A lovable alien is captured by the US army who plan to destroy him, prompting two officers to come to his aid. Spin-off from the sci-fi comedy TV series, with Miguel Ferrer, Ed Begley Jr and Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The Pyramid
programme.desc: A previously unexplored pyramid is discovered in the Egyptian desert, and a party of archaeologists sets out to uncover its secrets. The explorers soon find the tomb is riddled with deadly traps, but this proves the least of their worries when they realise it was built to contain dark forces that they have now unleashed. Horror, starring Ashley Hinshaw and Denis O'Hare.(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: A psychiatrist arrives on a space station to investigate the death of its commanding officer but subsequently starts to experience frightening visions of his late wife - which seem all too real and force him to question his sanity. Sci-fi drama, directed by Steven Soderbergh and based on Stanislaw Lem's novel, starring George Clooney, Natascha McElhone, Viola Davis, Jeremy Davies and Ulrich Tukur.(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: An explorer discovers a prehistoric monster-infested world deep beneath Earth's crust and faces a tough ordeal escaping the predatory attacks of the creatures as he tries to guide his team back to safety. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Pat Boone, James Mason, Arlene Dahl and Diane Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Gallows
programme.desc: A high-school play ends in tragedy when a boy is accidentally killed during a performance. The school puts on another production of the same show 20 years later which a gang of camcorder-wielding students intend to sabotage - but nobody is prepared for the ghost of the dead boy returning to terrorise the performance. Found-footage horror, starring Reese Mishler and Pfeifer Brown.(n)

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A colony of super-intelligent apes thrives following a global virus outbreak that wipes out much of the human race. A survivor tries to make peace with the leader of the apes, but their efforts to reach an understanding are threatened by warmongers on both sides. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Jason Clarke and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America.(n)

programme.title: Annabelle
programme.desc: A man buys his pregnant wife a vintage doll, which places their lives in jeopardy. Members of a Satanic cult have their eyes on the antique toy, and break into their house to prepare a ritual that will transform the harmless plaything into a terrifying monster. Horror spin-off from The Conjuring, starring Annabelle Wallis and Ward Horton.(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: A psychiatrist arrives on a space station to investigate the death of its commanding officer but subsequently starts to experience frightening visions of his late wife - which seem all too real and force him to question his sanity. Sci-fi drama, directed by Steven Soderbergh and based on Stanislaw Lem's novel, starring George Clooney, Natascha McElhone, Viola Davis, Jeremy Davies and Ulrich Tukur.(n)

Members of a Satanic cult have their eyes on the antique toy, and break into their house to prepare a ritual that will transform the harmless plaything into a terrifying monster. Horror spin-off from The Conjuring, starring Annabelle Wallis and Ward Horton.(n)

programme.title: Eyes Wide Shut
programme.desc: A successful doctor is shocked to discover his wife once harboured feelings for another man and resolves to get even by embarking on an affair of his own - only to end up involved with a dangerous exclusive cult. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Sydney Pollack and Marie Richardson.

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: Two middle-aged men embark on a wine-tasting tour in California a week before one of them is due to be married. The groom-to-be is determined to persuade his self-hating, embittered friend to loosen up - while also making it clear he intends to cheat on his fiancee before the week is out. Comedy, starring Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church, Virginia Madsen and Sandra Oh.

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Boxer Rubin `Hurricane' Carter dreams of winning the middleweight world title, only to be wrongfully thrown into prison for the murders of three people in a bar. Nineteen years later, a teenager reads the fighter's autobiography and sets out on a campaign to free him. Fact-based drama, starring Denzel Washington, John Hannah, Deborah Kara Unger, Liev Schreiber and Dan Hedaya.

programme.title: March of the Penguins
programme.desc: Luc Jacquet's Oscar-winning nature documentary follows a colony of emperor penguins on a journey hundreds of miles across the Antarctic ice to reach their breeding grounds, enduring harsh weather conditions and freezing temperatures along the way. Once they have mated, the males stay to guard the eggs while the females return to the sea to gather food. Narrated by Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A detective is sent to Alaska to investigate a murder during a month when the sun does not set. Sleep deprivation starts to take its toll, and he accidentally shoots his partner dead. He tries to cover it up, but the criminal they were hunting has seen everything and blackmails the cop into helping him escape justice. Thriller directed by Christopher Nolan, starring Al Pacino, Robin Williams and Hilary Swank.

programme.title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
programme.desc: An awkward teenager shuns all kinds of social interaction, apart from making films with his best friend. His well-meaning mother urges him to spend time with a girl who has been diagnosed with leukaemia, and they unexpectedly develop a firm friendship. However, his life is changed forever as her condition gets worse. Comedy drama based on Jesse Andrews' novel, starring Thomas Mann, RJ Cyler and Olivia Cooke.

programme.title: Sunset Boulevard
programme.desc: A faded film star from the silent-movie era is fixated with making a comeback. When she meets a struggling screenwriter on the run from debt collectors, she persuades him to write a script that will mark her spectacular return to the screen. However, he takes advantage of the deluded actress, becoming her lover in a relationship where their mutual deceit ends in tragedy. Drama, with Gloria Swanson, William Holden and Eric von Stroheim.

programme.title: Million Dollar Baby
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck boxing coach nurses a grudge because his best fighter has abandoned him for the big time. When a 31-year-old waitress turns up asking him to train her, he refuses outright. However, her persistence wins him round and the pair go on to form a strong professional partnership and successful career. Oscar-winning drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, alongside Hilary Swank, Morgan Freeman and Anthony Mackie.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, JK Simmons and Paul Reiser.

programme.title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
programme.desc: An awkward teenager shuns all kinds of social interaction, apart from making films with his best friend. His well-meaning mother urges him to spend time with a girl who has been diagnosed with leukaemia, and they unexpectedly develop a firm friendship. However, his life is changed forever as her condition gets worse. Comedy drama based on Jesse Andrews' novel, starring Thomas Mann, RJ Cyler and Olivia Cooke.

programme.title: Casino
programme.desc: A gambler takes over the running of a Las Vegas casino in the 1970s. His success is threatened by the arrival of an unstable old friend, now a powerful and ambitious mobster, an investigation by the FBI and his own wife's tortured past. Martin Scorsese's crime drama, starring Robert De Niro, Joe Pesci, Sharon Stone and James Woods.

programme.title: Theeb
programme.desc: A Bedouin boy living in an Ottoman province during the First World War offers to help his brother guide a British officer on a perilous journey through the desert to a secret destination. He gradually becomes more aware of the devastating events occurring in the world around him and is forced to grow up quickly. Drama, starring Jacir Eid Al-Hwietat and Jack Fox. In Arabic.(n)

programme.title: Hang 'Em High
programme.desc: A lawman-turned-rancher is attacked by a lynch mob and hanged for a crime he did not commit, but is rescued before he dies. He returns to his former profession to hunt the mob down, but his desire for revenge clashes with his responsibility to bring them to trial alive. Western, starring Clint Eastwood, Inger Stevens, Ed Begley, James MacArthur, Pat Hingle, Bruce Dern and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: The Face of an Angel
programme.desc: A journalist and a documentary-maker become obsessed with the murder case they are covering. Fact-based drama inspired by Amanda Knox's case and the death of Meredith Kercher in 2007, starring Daniel Bruhl, Kate Beckinsale and Cara Delevingne.(n)

programme.title: Dead Calm
programme.desc: A husband and wife take a yachting trip to help recover from the death of their son. While out on the open water the couple spot a sinking ship and manage to save the only person left on board - but they come to bitterly regret their good deed when the situation turns dark and a fraught battle of wits ensues. Thriller, based on a novel by Charles Williams, with Sam Neill, Nicole Kidman and Billy Zane.(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: A US congressman gets embroiled in a secret mission to provide covert military support to rebels in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan. Before long, he finds unlikely allies in the shape of a womanising CIA agent, a Texan socialite and the president of Pakistan. Fact-based political drama set during the 1980s, starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A woman whose son died during a car accident that left her in constant pain becomes obsessed with the suicide of a young mother she met at a support group, and forms a touching friendship with her husband. Drama, starring Jennifer Aniston, Anna Kendrick and Sam Worthington.(n)

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: A British colonel in a Japanese PoW camp is ordered to build a railway bridge over a river, forging a vital communications link. At first he refuses to obey, but eventually agrees to take the project on - and becomes so obsessed with the task that he creates a dilemma for an American soldier sent to destroy the structure. David Lean's Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Alec Guinness, William Holden and Jack Hawkins.(n)

programme.title: Flags of Our Fathers
programme.desc: The stories of three of the men in the famous photograph of US servicemen raising their flag on the island of Iwo Jima. After returning home from the battlefield, the veterans grapple with an increasing sense of survivor guilt as they struggle to adjust to everyday life. Clint Eastwood's Second World War drama, starring Adam Beach, Ryan Phillippe, Jesse Bradford, Jamie Bell and Paul Walker.(n)

programme.title: White Bird in a Blizzard
programme.desc: A teenager relishes her newfound freedom when her mother goes missing, seizing the opportunity to flirt with the boy next door and a cop on the case. Over time, she begins to realise what she has lost and finds the unexplained details of the disappearance haunting her. Mystery based on Laura Kasischke's novel, starring Shailene Woodley and Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: A teacher develops an irrational dislike for an overambitious student and plans to sabotage her campaign for school president. He persuades a dim-witted athlete to stand, in the hope he will pip the high-achieving front-runner to the post - but the intervention of another student throws the plan into disarray. Satirical comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Reese Witherspoon, Chris Klein and Jessica Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Hustle & Flow
programme.desc: A pimp and drug pusher decides to change his ways after reaching the age at which his father died. Using his experience of life on the streets, he becomes a rapper, and an encounter with a local hip-hop star gives him the perfect chance to begin his career in music. Drama, starring Terrence Howard, Anthony Anderson, Taryn Manning and Isaac Hayes.(n)

programme.title: 13 Assassins
programme.desc: A ruthless feudal lord rises to prominence in 19th-century Japan, using his political influence to gain more power, with which he commits atrocities against the populace. A government official realises he is a threat to the entire nation, and recruits 13 samurai warriors to assassinate him. Action adventure, starring Koji Yakusho and Takayuki Yamada. In Japanese.

programme.title: St Trinian's
programme.desc: An anarchic girls' boarding school is threatened with closure, owing to financial difficulties and a strict education minister determined to clean up its bad reputation. The pupils realise their hapless teachers are unable to deal with the crisis, so plan to save the day by dabbling in art theft. Comedy, starring Rupert Everett in a dual role alongside Colin Firth, Russell Brand and Gemma Arterton.

programme.title: The Core
programme.desc: A chain of bizarre and deadly incidents in several countries leads scientists to the conclusion that the Earth's core has stopped spinning. As chaos erupts around the world, experts hatch a plan to halt the destruction and save the human race - but it involves venturing deep below the planet's surface to detonate a nuclear bomb. Sci-fi thriller, starring Aaron Eckhart, Hilary Swank, Stanley Tucci and DJ Qualls.

programme.title: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
programme.desc: An elderly bamboo cutter finds a tiny princess hidden in a tree, little realising she will grow up to be a beautiful, strong-willed woman. After receiving several marriage proposals, she sets her suitors a variety of challenges in an attempt to learn which of them deserves to win her heart. Animated fantasy, featuring the voice of Chloe Grace Moretz, James Caan and Mary Steenburgen.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt sent to find and destroy the only sample of a deadly man-made virus. However, he faces tough opposition in a former spy-turned-criminal mastermind who has already acquired the cure and now wants the pathogen itself. Director John Woo's action thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Dougray Scott, Thandie Newton and Anthony Hopkins.

programme.title: Die Hard 2
programme.desc: Tough cop John McClane arrives at an airport to pick up his wife, but finds himself plunged into a bloody life-or-death struggle. He must battle terrorists who have seized control of the terminal as part of a campaign to secure the release of a convicted drug baron. Action thriller sequel, starring Bruce Willis, Bonnie Bedelia, William Sadler, Franco Nero and William Atherton.

programme.title: Zero Dark Thirty
programme.desc: A CIA operative joins a team of intelligence and military operatives in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks. She spends the next 10 years searching for information on the whereabouts of Osama bin Laden, ultimately leading to the final raid on the terrorist leader's hideout. Kathryn Bigelow's fact-based drama, starring Jessica Chastain and Mark Strong.

programme.title: Apartment 143
programme.desc: Supernatural activity forces a family to leave their house and move to an apartment building - but soon the haunting begins again in their new home. A team of paranormal researchers is called in to document the disturbing events and discover what is causing them. Horror, starring Francesc Garrido and Fiona Glascott.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: A clumsy security guard is critically injured during a run-in with a thief, so his cybernetics-expert employer transforms him into the ultimate crime-fighting machine - a bionic officer with an array of gadgets and weaponry cunningly concealed inside his body. Disney comedy adventure based on the 1980s cartoon series, starring Matthew Broderick, Rupert Everett and Joely Fisher.(n)

programme.title: Bugsy Malone
programme.desc: Alan Parker's slapstick musical comedy, featuring a cast composed entirely of children and following a war between rival gangsters in 1920s New York - fought with custard pies and cream-firing Tommy guns. When a slick mobster acquires devastating new weapons, his arch rival enlists the aid of a small-time chancer to steal them. Starring Scott Baio, Florrie Dugger and John Cassisi, with Jodie Foster in an early appearance.(n)

programme.title: Magic in the Water
programme.desc: Two children investigate the legend of a mythical creature rumoured to live in the lake by their holiday home. They are astonished when they discover the monster and find it is actually quite friendly - and is eager to help the children thwart a company dumping toxic waste in the water. Family adventure, starring Mark Harmon, Joshua Jackson and Harley Jane Kozak.(n)

programme.title: Mirror Mirror
programme.desc: A princess is banished to a dark forest after the death of her father, leaving her wicked stepmother to rule over the kingdom. The exiled aristocrat joins forces with a band of rebellious dwarfs to reclaim her father's throne and stop the evil queen seducing the prince she is in love with. Fantasy, starring Julia Roberts, Lily Collins and Armie Hammer.(n)

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: A slobbish guitarist dreams of stardom, but his hopes are dashed when the other members of his band kick him out. Struggling to make ends meet, he takes a job as a supply teacher at an exclusive private school, and sets about moulding his pupils into rock gods. Comedy from director Richard Linklater, starring Jack Black, Joan Cusack, Mike White and Sarah Silverman.(n)

programme.title: Red 2
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Frank Moses reunites his squad of retired operatives for a vital mission. A devastatingly powerful new weapon has been stolen, and it falls to Frank's team to retrieve it - which means facing lethal assassins, terrorists and corrupt government officials out to steal the device. Action thriller sequel, starring Bruce Willis, Helen Mirren and John Malkovich.(n)

programme.title: Requiem for a Dream
programme.desc: Four drug-addicted people go into a downward spiral with devastating effects on their families. A woman takes diet pills in a bid to look slim for her appearance on a TV show, her heroin-addict son and his friend turn to crime to pay for their addiction, and one of the boys' girlfriends faces her own battle with narcotics. Darren Aronofsky's drama, based on the novel by Hubert Selby Jr and starring Jared Leto, Ellen Burstyn, Marlon Wayans and Jennifer Connelly.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family learn their father's old flame has bought an inn, and rally round to protect him from her. Elizabeth and Cindy open a canteen for the soldiers.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob is rejected by the air force, so joins the army instead. Mary Ellen tries to matchmake Erin with a friend of Curt.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary is chosen to compete in a state maths contest, but learns she cannot afford to go. American Western drama, starring Melissa Sue Anderson.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The group goes on a camping trip, but Caroline scratches herself on a piece of baling wire and develops a dangerous infection in her leg. Charles and the other girls are not around to help.

programme.title: Blue Valley Songbird
programme.desc: A talented singer-songwriter's love of country music provides her with a means of escaping the clutches of her abusive manager-boyfriend and starting a new life. Drama, starring Dolly Parton, John Terry, Billy Dean and Kimberley Kates.

programme.title: The Christmas Wish
programme.desc: A businessman returns to his hometown to spend the festive season with his grandmother - but when the pair decide to read her dead husband's diary, they make the shocking discovery that he used to spend every Christmas Eve with another woman. Luckily, the revelation leads them to make important discoveries about themselves. Seasonal drama, starring Debbie Reynolds, Neil Patrick Harris and Naomi Watts.

programme.title: Lethal Seduction
programme.desc: A reporter poses as an illegal immigrant and takes a job in the office of a ruthless, seductive lawyer, hoping to expose her corrupt business practices. However, his pursuit of a story is threatened when he becomes infatuated with her. Comedy drama, starring Melanie Griffith and Esai Morales.

programme.title: Stolen Babies
programme.desc: A welfare worker attempts to bring down a woman she believes is running an illegal adoption racket, but finds her efforts constantly thwarted by her adversary's society connections. Fact-based drama, starring Lea Thompson and Mary Tyler Moore.

programme.title: Chasing Secrets
programme.desc: An abused youngster suffers at the hands of her uncaring grandparents, until she is taken under the wing of an elderly couple - who struggle to help her lay the ghosts of the past to rest. Drama, starring Della Reese, Ossie Davis and Crystal Bernhard.

programme.title: The Unspoken Truth
programme.desc: A woman marries a dangerously volatile man, who one night shoots a man in a fit of rage. He forces her to claim she shot the man by accident, a lie which leaves her facing a life sentence and the possibility of losing her daughter. Fact-based drama, starring Lea Thompson, James Marshall, Patricia Kalember and Robert Englund.

programme.title: For Love of Olivia
programme.desc: A small-town lawyer running for congress is blackmailed into defending a man accused of murder - and to make matters worse, his wife is harbouring a shocking secret. Thriller, starring Louis Gossett Jr, Robert Urich and Lonette McKee.

programme.title: Thicker Than Blood
programme.desc: A man's agonising courtroom battle to gain custody of his son is dealt a crippling blow by the discovery that he isn't the youngster's real father after all. Drama, starring Peter Strauss and Rachel Ticotin.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
programme.desc: Fact-based drama based on the famous journal of a Jewish youngster forced to hide with her family from occupying Nazis in an Amsterdam attic for two years. Starring Melissa Gilbert, Maximilian Schell and Joan Plowright.

programme.title: Against Her Will: The Carrie Buck Story
programme.desc: A woman with learning disabilities is declared unfit to raise her newborn daughter, but goes to court to fight for custody of the child. Drama, starring Marlee Matlin, Melissa Gilbert and Pat Hingle.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason has to compose a piece of original music for his course, and draws inspiration from his mountain home.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. John searches for a missing soldier, Jim Bob is attacked by a grieving father, and the family receives distressing news from the front line.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary, Laura and Carl look round a railway wagon at the station, only for it to start moving into the path of an oncoming train.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A new teacher falsely blames Laura for several problems, and tries to have her thrown out of school when test papers become damaged.(n)

programme.title: A Holiday for Love
programme.desc: A hard-nosed businessman returns to his home town in Nebraska at Christmas to organise large-scale redundancies at the factory which supports most of the families in the area. As the season of goodwill draws near, he finds himself falling in love with a member of the workforce. Drama, starring Tim Matheson, Melissa Gilbert and Michelle Trachtenberg.(n)

programme.title: One Special Victory
programme.desc: An estate agent convicted of corruption is sentenced to coach a Paralympics basketball team as part of his community service. Drama, starring John Larroquette, Kathy Baker, Ray Walston and Joe Pantoliano.(n)

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: A washed-up alcoholic former lawyer is persuaded to return to the courtroom by an ex-lover, whose daughter is charged with murder. He agrees to take on the case, but finds himself at the centre of the media circus as the prosecution uses his drink problem to undermine his credibility. Courtroom drama, starring Brian Dennehy, Bonnie Bedelia and Fairuza Balk.(n)

programme.title: The Forget-Me-Not Murders
programme.desc: A policeman races against time to find a serial killer who leaves dried flowers next to each of his victims, and the chase becomes even more desperate when he learns that his goddaughter could be next on the murderer's list. Detective thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Tyne Daly, Cliff Gorman and Neve Campbell.(n)

programme.title: The Christmas Shoes
programme.desc: A little boy is determined to do whatever he can to buy his dying mother a pair of expensive red shoes. Along the way, his tireless efforts inspire an amazing transformation in the life of a cold-hearted lawyer struggling to cope with the slow disintegration of his marriage. Festive family drama, starring Rob Lowe, Maria Del Mar, Max Morrow and Kimberly Williams.(n)

programme.title: Christmas in Canaan
programme.desc: Two boys, one black and the other white, grow up in a racially divided Texas community in the 1960s. The pair take an instant dislike to each other, but their families are determined to end the conflict by forcing them to spend time together. The youngsters grow to become firm friends, but the tension among their neighbours is harder to resolve. Drama, with Jaishon Fisher and Zak Ludwig.(n)

programme.title: A Grandpa for Christmas
programme.desc: An elderly actor who is happiest with his own company unexpectedly ends up having to care for his grand-daughter over Christmas when her mother is hospitalised in a car crash. Although the pair find it hard to get along at first, they eventually bond while working on a school pageant. Family comedy, starring Ernest Borgnine, Juliette Goglia and Katherine Helmond.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana: Where Now
programme.desc: Documentary examining the princess's life following her divorce.(n)

programme.title: Fergie: The Downfall of a Princess
programme.desc: Documentary examining the rise and fall of Sarah Ferguson in the public eye.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana: In Search of Happiness
programme.desc: A review of the life of Diana, Princess of Wales, including her childhood, her move into the public eye, her work for charity, her marriage and her death.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana: A Day in the Life
programme.desc: Documentary examining Lady Diana Spencer's sometimes awkward transition into royalty and the princess's day to day life in the public eye.(n)

programme.title: Born Innocent
programme.desc: A teenage runaway is sent to a centre for young offenders by her neglectful parents, where she experiences brutal treatment from the violent inmates and uncaring staff. However, one care worker is determined to help her realise her potential and escape her unhappy surroundings. Drama, starring Linda Blair and Joanna Miles.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help an Asian woman whose family have recently arrived in America to protect them from racial prejudice.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark get jobs working in a hotel and help a millionaire's son to find some purpose in his life.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.sub-title: Island in the Desert - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Festus is left wounded in the desert, but is rescued by an eccentric hermit.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.sub-title: Island in the Desert - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Hermit Ben Snow forces Festus to carry a shipment of gold back to civilisation.

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.sub-title: There but for the Grace of God.
programme.desc: Monica gives up her angelic powers to help a homeless old man. Roma Downey and Della Reese star.

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Tess and Monica return to the site of a previous assignment, where they find themselves battling with the Devil himself. Guest starring John Schneider (Smallville).

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy agrees to work for a local man in exchange for a car, but ends up being taken for a ride when the scoundrel reneges on the deal.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. The family help their relatives to make a stand against the authorities, following the issuing of an eviction notice.

programme.title: Fatal Vows: The Alexandra O'Hara Story
programme.desc: A woman realises her new husband may be a serial rapist and murderer, and tries to provide the police with evidence of his guilt without becoming his next victim. Fact-based thriller, starring Cynthia Gibb and John Stamos.

programme.title: Great Escape 2: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Part two of two. A daring army major returns to Germany to capture the Gestapo officer who ordered the massacre of 50 of his men. Second World War drama, starring Christopher Reeve.

programme.title: Runaway Car
programme.desc: The accelerator on a woman's car jams, leaving its passengers facing a terrifying ordeal as they attempt to find a way of bringing the vehicle to a stop. Action thriller, with Judge Reinhold, Nina Siemaszko, Brian Hooks and Leon.

programme.title: Ann Rule's The Stranger Beside Me
programme.desc: An aspiring crime reporter is hired to investigate a series of grisly, unsolved murders stretching from Utah to Seattle, only to discover the killer is one of her closest friends. Fact-based thriller, starring Bill Campbell, Barbara Hershey, Kevin Dunn and Suki Kaiser.

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd.

programme.title: No One Could Protect Her
programme.desc: A woman is raped in her own home, but the police seem powerless to apprehend the attacker. As reports of further sexual assaults in her neighbourhood mount up, all seemingly the work of the same man, she resolves to turn detective and bring him to justice herself. Thriller based on a true story, starring Joanna Kerns, Anthony John Denison and Peter MacNeill.

programme.title: Escape from Terror: The Teresa Stamper Story
programme.desc: A woman falls in love with the man she believes is Mr Right and hastily marries him, but it isn't long before he begins showing his true colours, forcing her to seek shelter at a safe house. Fact-based drama, starring Maria Pitillo, Adam Storke and Brad Dourif.

programme.title: Sacrifices of the Heart
programme.desc: A Los Angeles lawyer returns to the family home when she learns her estranged father has started to show signs of Alzheimer's disease. She hopes to resolve the problems that drove them apart and confront a deeply traumatic experience from her childhood. Drama, starring Melissa Gilbert, Ken Howard, Cyril O'Reilly and Lisa Pelikan.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark spend Christmas trying to show a crooked car salesman the error of his ways.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan helps Mark to find an old friend who has been missing for five days, but finds nobody is willing to talk about him.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A military officer has a painful reunion with his daughter. Guest starring Daniel J Travanti (Hill Street Blues) and Lee J Cobb (The Exorcist) with real-life daughter Julie.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Festus is forced to work for a farming family when he brings one of them home wounded. Guest starring Bruce Boxleitner (Babylon 5) and Lisa Eilbacher (An Officer and a Gentleman).(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Tess instructs Monica to respond to a news advert looking for an angel. Callie doubts Monica until she tells her about the cases she has worked on.(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Monica poses as a cop to help a police officer wounded in a shooting, but during a drug raid she finds he has become addicted to medication. Drama, starring Roma Downey and Della Reese star.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Problems arise during John-Boy's first day at Boatwright College.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia takes a night-school art class and receives other attentions from the instructor.(n)

programme.title: Calendar Girl Murders
programme.desc: A detective is sent to investigate when the stars of a new raunchy calendar are murdered one at a time. He faces a race against time to find the killer before more blood is shed. Thriller, starring Tom Skerritt and Sharon Stone.(n)

programme.title: Jack Reed: One of Our Own
programme.desc: The maverick detective's partner is murdered by a hitman they were investigating and he sets out to bring him to justice with the help of the killer's girlfriend. Thriller, directed by and starring Brian Dennehy. With Susan Ruttan, Charles Dutton and CCH Pounder.(n)

programme.title: Death in the Shadows
programme.desc: A man becomes convinced that his father is innocent of murdering his mother - despite his conviction in a court of law. Determined to get to the truth, he begins his own investigation, but faces an arduous struggle to ensure the real killer is finally brought to justice. Fact-based thriller, starring Peter Strauss, Henry Czerny and Lindsay Frost.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Mary Ellen takes drugs to cope with the stress of her exams, and Sissy leaves her husband.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura holds Doc Baker responsible for her son's death, causing the rest of the town to reject him.(n)

programme.title: Custody of the Heart
programme.desc: An outgoing, ambitious career woman divides her time between work, family and caring for her elderly mother. But her stay-at-home husband develops a strong inferiority complex and demands a divorce, claiming he should get sole custody of the children. Drama, starring Lorraine Bracco, Martin Donovan, Dennis Boutsikaris and John Neville.(n)

programme.title: The Crooked E: The Unshredded Truth About Enron
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the scandal surrounding the collapse of the American company, which left employees jobless and thousands of people without their life savings. Based on an insider's memoirs, starring Christian Kane, Shannon Elizabeth and Mike Farrell.(n)

programme.title: The King and Queen of Moonlight Bay
programme.desc: A reclusive and emotionally wrecked handyman is reunited with the estranged 17-year-old daughter he left behind years before, and embarks on the task of repairing their fragile relationship - but the pair face an uphill struggle because they share the same stubborn streak. Drama, based on Michael De Guzman's novel, starring Tim Matheson, Sean Young and Kristen Bell.(n)

programme.title: Meat Loaf: To Hell and Back
programme.desc: Biopic charting the rocker's early years and how he overcame his bullying father and a lifelong weight problem to achieve international fame. W Earl Brown, Dedee Pfeiffer and Zachary Throne star.(n)

programme.title: Roadies
programme.desc: Longest Days. Janine shakes things up with the band and crew; Wes treats Winston to a guitar lesson from a rock legend(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Fish and Bird. Ray waits to see if Belikov will be released from prison and struggles with the prospect of putting a pimp back out on the street. Later, Art dealer Sonia Kovitsky invites Ray to a breast cancer benefit where he encounters some former clients and becomes more entrenched in her operation. Meanwhile, Teresa spirals into a postpartum depression; and Mickey tries to persuade the DA that he was the sole architect behind the Minassian massacre(n)

programme.title: The Circus: Inside The Greatest Political Show on Earth
programme.desc: In the Arena. The Democrats make Hillary Clinton a historic nominee; Bernie Sanders diehards jeer and boo in Philadelphia. Also: a look at whether shattering the glass ceiling is enough for Clinton and Kaine to unite their party into a winning coalition(n)

programme.title: Unnatural

programme.title: Saw II
programme.desc: Jigsaw, the diabolical criminal who captured the imagination of horror fans in the 2004 hit Saw, returns in this equally bloody sequel. Eric Matthews (Donnie Wahlberg) is a police detective who, after discovering the aftermath of a particularly gruesome murder, is convinced that Jigsaw (Tobin Bell) is up to his ugly tricks again. Matthews' hunch turns out to be correct, but the master criminal proves to be disconcertingly easy to capture. As it happens, Jigsaw is eager to be put behind bars in order to throw the authorities off his trail as he once again punishes people who in his eyes have transgressed the boundaries of acceptable moral behavior. But instead of trapping two people in a filthy dungeon where they must engage in a terrible contest in order to win their freedom, eight people have been locked away by Jigsaw, and they must torture their bodies and minds to achieve the terrible justice Jigsaw seeks. Saw II was written by Leigh Whannell, who also scripted the first film(n)

programme.title: The Railway Man
programme.desc: A British soldier who was held as a prisoner of war by the Japanese during World War II confronts the guard who tortured him in order to find closure to that painful chapter of his life(n)

programme.title: Wonder Boys
programme.desc: Comic drama about a professor suffering from writer's block trying to deal with the pressures of his complex love life and his troubled students' assorted problems. Despite the encouragement of one his admiring female pupils, the professor is obsessed with his current work. He finds release in his friendship with a lonely but gifted student, but the news of his lover's pregnancy further complicates his already difficult life(n)

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey
programme.desc: An Indian teen in France goes to work for his father's culinary adversary in this drama based on the bestselling novel by Richard C. Morais. Put young Hassan Kadam (Manish Dayal) in a kitchen, and he's bound to emerge with a dish that will dazzle. When Hassan's family is forced to move from their native India, his Papa (Om Puri) relocates to a peaceful hamlet in Saint-Antonin-Noble-Val in the south of France. Determined to give his new neighbors a little taste of home, Papa decides to open an Indian restaurant in the village, and names it Maison Mumbai. Meanwhile, across the street at the traditional French restaurant Le Saule Pleureu, uptight proprietor Madame Mallory (Helen Mirren) doesn't exactly welcome the competition. When Madame Mallory ignites a bitter feud that quickly escalates, the only hope for a peaceful resolution lies in Hassan's talent for French haute cuisine, and his growing affections for Mme. Mallory's pretty young sous chef Marguerite (Charlotte Le Bon). Subsequently impressed by Hassan's undeniable culinary talents, Mme. Mallory agrees to become Hassan's mentor, in the process providing the perfect creative environment where his unique fusion cuisine can thrive. Lasse Hallström directs a film produced by Steven Spielberg, Oprah Winfrey, and Juliet Blake(n)

programme.title: Jamie Marks Is Dead
programme.desc: A high school track star receives strange insight into the afterlife when he is repeatedly visited by the ghost of an unpopular classmate who perished under mysterious circumstances. Based on author Christopher Barzak's novel One for Sorrow, Jamie Marks is Dead opens to find upstate New York teen Gracie (Morgan Saylor) scavenging for rocks when she happens across the corpse of classmate Jamie Marks (Noah Silver), who led a lonely life on the bottom rungs of the social ladder. As local police launch their investigation into Jamie's death, popular runner Adam (Cameron Monaghan) experiences pangs of guilt over his own inaction upon seeing his late classmate bullied by their fellow students. Shortly after appearing to Grace in spectral form, Jamie also begins to haunt Adam, whose lingering guilt prompts him to begin communicating with the troubled apparition. Later, his relationship with Gracie intensifying as his relationship with his paralyzed single-mother (Liv Tyler) turns sour, Adam follows Jamie's advice and flees to an abandoned farmhouse, where he has a terrifying encounter with a malevolent spirit whose motivations appear to be much darker than those of the mournful Jamie. Judy Greer, Ryan Munzert, and Madisen Beaty co-star(n)

programme.title: The Stanford Prison Experiment
programme.desc: Kyle Patrick Alvarez's drama The Stanford Prison Experiment is based on real events. Dr. Philip Zimbardo (Billy Cruddup) arranges for 24 volunteers to be either guards or inmates a makeshift prison system so that he can observe how their behavior changes. Eventually those playing guards become abusive and dictatorial, while the inmates band together to survive the harsh conditions. What the Stanford professor doesn't expect is that he and the people running the experiment are also being transformed by taking part in it. The Stanford Prison Experiment screened at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival

programme.title: Sleeping With Other People
programme.desc: Lainey (Alison Brie) and Jake (Jason Sudeikis) lost their virginities to each other in college, and they meet again, years later, when they attend the same meeting for sex addiction. Both of their love lives are disasters, and after rekindling their friendship, they vow to keep their relationship platonic so they can help each other with their problems: Jake is a womanizer who can't commit, while Lainey hasn't gotten over a married doctor (Adam Scott) she's been having an affair with. In time, Jake falls for a high-powered businesswoman (Amanda Peet) who buys his start-up company, while Lainey starts dating a financier (Marc Blucas). Yet through it all, they feel closer to each other than to any of their actual partners. Jason Mantzoukas and Andrea Savage co-star as a married couple who are friends with Jake, and who pressure him to settle down to avoid being the weird single guy at their parties (the end credits feature a hilarious sequence in which the two of them banter about the state of their marriage). Sleeping With Other People was written and directed by Leslye Headland(n)

programme.title: Backcountry
programme.desc: A young couple on a weekend camping trip into the wilderness wage a grueling struggle for survival in this visceral thriller from Canada. Jenn (Missy Peregrym) is a high-powered executive whose cellphone is never out of reach. Determined to salvage their troubled relationship, Jenn's boyfriend Alex (Jeff Roop) takes them to a secluded campsite near a scenic lake where he used to play as a child. After popping their tent, the couple are settling in when lone hiker Brad (Eric Balfour) appears out of nowhere, and joins them for dinner. The fire dimming later that evening, however, Brad departs, leaving Jenn and Alex to prepare for their long hike the following day. Setting out bright and early, the couple make their way ever deeper into the sprawling forest, only realizing they're hopelessly lost once darkness begins to fall. Meanwhile, their nightmare has only just begun, because many dangers dwell in the forest, and they're about to face the worst one imaginable

She goes off the rails, sleeping around until one encounter leaves her semi-naked in the road, where she's found by Lazarus, who's nursing his own hurt of a cheating wife. Determined to save Rae from herself, he initially imprisons her in his home but, as the two form a relationship, so she begins to understand the reasons behind her actions(r)

programme.title: Good Kill
programme.desc: Andrew Niccol's 21st century war drama Good Kill stars Ethan Hawke as Air Force Major Thomas Egan, a talented pilot who spends his days operating a drone over various terrorist threats in the middle east while sitting in a trailer on a base in Las Vegas. Egan hates not being allowed to fly actual planes anymore, and as the CIA begins dictating orders to Egan and his crew, he begins to feel morally disconnected from his job. This leads to more conflict at home with his wife (January Jones), who wishes her husband could focus on their family as much as his military duty. Good Kill screened at the 2014 Toronto International Film Festival

programme.title: The DUFF
programme.desc: Emotionally devastated after learning that she's secretly referred to as "The DUFF" (Designated Ugly Fat Friend) by the entire student body, high-school senior Bianca (Mae Whitman) dismisses the cautionary advice of her favorite teacher (Ken Jeong), turns her back on her longtime crush Toby (Nick Eversman), and enlists the help of charismatic jock Wesley (Robbie Amell) to help salvage what's left of her senior year. As the once-contented senior wages a monumental struggle to regain her confidence, she gradually turns her efforts toward knocking cruel class queen bee Madison (Bella Thorne) from her throne up on high. Based on the popular novel by Kody Keplinger(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: (2003) Starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi. Directed by Sofia Coppola. Everyone wants to be found. Sometimes you have to go halfway around the world to come full circle. A movie star with a sense of emptiness, and a neglected newlywed meet up as strangers in Tokyo, Japan and form an unlikely bond(n)

programme.title: Wonder Boys
programme.desc: In this comedy, a middle-aged man juggles his problems with women, literature, and a career, while a younger man chases the artifact of his dreams. Pittsburgh college professor Grady Tripp (Michael Douglas) is currently single following his divorce from his third wife; after publishing an acclaimed first novel, Grady has been working on a follow-up, but he's been sidelined by a severe case of writer's block. Grady has more than his writing career to think about; his affair with one of the (married) chancellors at the University of Pittsburgh (Frances McDormand), has resulted in her pregnancy, while Hannah (Katie Holmes), a student boarding at Grady's house, has developed a crush on him. While Grady is obsessed with his book, one of his students (Tobey Maguire) has an obsession of his own: finding a jacket once owned by Marilyn Monroe. Based on the novel by Michael Chabon, The Wonder Boys also features Robert Downey Jr., Rip Torn, and Richard Thomas(n)

programme.title: Cas & Dylan
programme.desc: Self-proclaimed loner Dr. Cas Pepper (Richard Dreyfuss) finds himself on the run with an aspiring young writer who hopes to help Cas overcome the writer's block that is preventing him from writing a proper suicide note. Along the way, the unlikely pair discover life has more to teach them both(n)

programme.title: The DUFF
programme.desc: Emotionally devastated after learning that she's secretly referred to as "The DUFF" (Designated Ugly Fat Friend) by the entire student body, high-school senior Bianca (Mae Whitman) dismisses the cautionary advice of her favorite teacher (Ken Jeong), turns her back on her longtime crush Toby (Nick Eversman), and enlists the help of charismatic jock Wesley (Robbie Amell) to help salvage what's left of her senior year. programme.title: State Property 2
programme.desc: Hip-hop mogul Damon Dash wrote, directed, and stars in this hard-hitting examination of life in the criminal underground of a great city. Three different crime bosses are locked in a battle over the drug trade in Philadelphia. New York transplant Dame (Damon Dash) and his umbrella crew command a powerful network that controls the city's dope traffic, but he has two bitter rivals who both oversee competing gangs from behind bars -- Beans (Beanie Siegel), Philly-born leader of the once-dominant ABM Crime Syndicate, and Loco (Noreaga), a slick street hustler from Miami who has the bankroll to finance a powerful operation. As these three men and their underlings scramble for money and power, another player is quietly consolidating his forces and rising up against them. State Property 2: Philly Streets also features supporting performances from Mariah Carey, Ol' Dirty Bastard, Cam'ron, and a handful of other hip-hop and R&B stars(n)

programme.title: Deterrence
programme.desc: The year is 2008 and US President Walter Emerson , is forced to make a monumental decision that will affect world history, in this taut political thriller. Trapped by a freak snowstorm in a tiny mid-American town in Colorado whilst campaigning for re-election, Emerson receives word that Iraqi dictator Uday Hussein has staged a surprise attack on Kuwait. It is the same type of attack which provoked the Gulf War in 1990, but this time Iraq has chemical and biological weapons ready to fire on Israel, Greece and Turkey(n)

programme.title: Turbulence 2: Fear of Flying
programme.desc: A group of people who have completed a therapy program to overcome their severe fear of flying celebrate with a group flight to L.A. However, they soon discover that there are perfectly good reasons to be afraid of airliners -- a group of terrorists highjack the jet, murdering the pilot and threatening to kill all the passengers with chemical weapons. With the captain's chair empty, one of the passengers is forced to bring the plane safely to the ground(n)

programme.title: Bloodsucking Bastards
programme.desc: In this black comedy about workplace politics of the undead, cubicle dweller Evan (Fran Kranz) starts to worry about his chance for a promotion when it looks like his office has been infiltrated by vampires(n)

programme.title: Unnatural

programme.title: Zodiac
programme.desc: Mesmerizing fact-based thriller about the search for the elusive mass murderer known as the Zodiac Killer, who terrorized the San Francisco Bay Area for a number of years in the 1970s. Jake Gyllenhaal plays newspaper political cartoonist Robert Graysmith, upon whose book the script is based. Mark Ruffalo plays Insp. Dave Toschi, who was the inspiration for the title characters in Steve McQueen's "Bullitt" and Clint Eastwood's "Dirty Harry." Robert Downey Jr. Directed by David Fincher(n)

programme.title: Killing Season
programme.desc: An ex-soldier tracks down a fellow veteran of the Bosnian War in search of revenge, leading to a showdown in the Appalachian Mountains(n)

programme.title: Saw
programme.desc: Adam and Lawrence have been chained up in a filthy bathroom with a corpse lying between them. They are the latest victims of 'Jigsaw', a madman who's twisted games always leave the players dead... or worse. Horror(n)

programme.title: Tart
programme.desc: Cat Storm (Dominique Swain) is a bored high school girl in New York City who follows her petulant, rich friends from one coming-of-age adventure to another. They experiment with cruelty, rudeness, brazenness, and idiocy before moving onto sex and drugs. Cat's best friend, Delilah (Bijou Phillips), is kicked out of school for using cocaine (her father's), forcing Cat to become best friends with Grace (Mischa Barton), who guides her into the arms of William (Brad Renfro), the boy Cat's had a crush on for some time. Eventually they all wind up at a luxurious country estate for a weekend of drugs, passion, and, inevitably, gruesome murder(n)

programme.title: NYC Underground
programme.desc: Rich Manhattan kids head to Brooklyn for a concert, and cross a group of thugs who send them fleeing into the subway system(n)

programme.title: Let Us Prey
programme.desc: Rachel is a rookie cop ready to begin her first night shift in the local police station of small Scottish, backwater town. However, this is a night she will never forget; for when Six arrives...all hell will break loose, with Rachel caught right in the centre of it(n)

programme.title: Heatstroke
programme.desc: A research scientist, his girlfriend and his teenage daughter fight for their lives in the African desert after incurring the wrath of ruthless arms dealers(n)

programme.title: Liberty Stands Still
programme.desc: When his daughter is killed by an illegally purchased firearm during a high school shooting, a normally pacifistic man named Joe (Wesley Snipes) goes off the deep end. Vowing to get even with the gun manufacturer who created the weapon, Joe targets the manufacturer's widow, Liberty Wallace (Linda Fiorento), for a complex scheme of justice and retribution. Armed with a cell phone and a long-range rifle, Joe orders Liberty to handcuff herself to an outdoor hot dog stand, wired with a time bomb. As the clock ticks inexorably closer to the inevitable explosion, the terrified but resourceful Liberty tries to talk her way out of her predicament--a task made virtually impossible by Joe's bizarre "conditions". First screened in America at the 2002 Palm Springs International Film Festival, Liberty Stands Still did not gain a widespread showing until it was picked up for cable broadcast by Cinemax on August 10, 2002(n)

programme.title: Seventh Moon
programme.desc: A romantic trip to China turns into a lunar nightmare for a pair of happy newlyweds when their taxi driver ditches them in a remote village, and the locals offer them up as sacrifices for the menacing moon creatures that return to Earth annually to replenish their ranks. According to Chinese legend, the dead return to Earth on the seventh month of the lunar year, when the moon glows full in the night sky. America-born Yul (Tim Chiou) and his new wife Melissa (Amy Smart) had just arrived in China to meet Yul's family when their idyllic getaway takes a sudden turn for the worse. When night falls and their tour guide leaves them stranded in a darkened, boarded-up village, Yul and Amy quickly realize that this wasn't a planned stop. Once a year, the lunar creatures return to Earth in search of a sacrifice. Yul and Amy have just been offered up, and now in order to avoid being assimilated into the collective that pursues them through the darkened forest, they will have to survive until the morning light casts the frightful beasts back to the moon for another year(n)

programme.title: Begin Again
programme.desc: An ambitious young female singer moves to New York City in search of stardom, but finds only disappointment until falling for a struggling record-industry executive who helps her down the road to fame. Songwriting duo Gretta (Keira Knightley) and Dave (Adam Levine) had been dating since college when they decided to seek their fortune in NYC. When Dave is signed by a major label, temptation proves too powerful for him to resist and the couple call it quits. Crestfallen, Gretta fights to get back on her feet until one night, while performing in the East Village, she catches the attention of Dan (Mark Ruffalo), a once-respected music executive who's since fallen on hard times. Enchanted by Gretta's powerful voice and skillful songwriting, Dan convinces her to join him in a collaboration that will transform them both over the course of one unforgettable summer. Written and directed by John Carney (Once, Zonad)(n)

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides
programme.desc: A group of male friends become obsessed with a family of mysterious sisters who are sheltered by their strict, religious parents after one of them commits suicide(n)

Louis Gossett Jr., Tasha Smith, Tracee Ellis Ross, Malinda Williams(n)

programme.title: The Bucket List
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson and Morgan Freeman star as two terminally ill cancer patients who decide to break out of the hospital and live their last days to the fullest in director Rob Reiner's seriocomic road movie. Edward Cole (Nicholson) is a corporate billionaire who is currently sharing a hospital room with blue-collar mechanic Carter Chambers (Freeman). Though initially the pair seems to have nothing in common, conversation gradually reveals that both men have a long list of goals they wish to accomplish before they kick the bucket, and an unrealized desire to discover what kind of men they really are. But one can't accomplish such lofty objectives from the confines of a hospital bed, so now, in order to live their lives to the absolute fullest, Edward and Carter will have to make a break for it. With a checklist that includes playing the poker tables in Monte Carlo, consuming copious amounts of caviar, racing the fastest machines on four wheels, and much more, these two terminally ill men will do their best to fit a lifetime of experience into their last remaining days while forging an unlikely, but truly remarkable, friendship

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie

Schulz's iconic characters are brought to life in state of the art 3D animation from Blue Sky Studios, the creators of the Ice Age films. Directed by Steve Martino. programme.title: Joy Ride
programme.desc: After forays into film noir, thrillers, dramas, and even documentaries, director John Dahl tries the teen horror genre on for size. Paul Walker stars as Lewis Thomas, a college freshman embarking on a cross-country road trip during summer break to pick up his girlfriend Venna (Leelee Sobieski). Along for the ride is Lewis' brother Fuller (Steve Zahn), a practical joker who uses the car's CB radio to play a cruel prank on a lonely trucker known only by the handle Rusty Nail. The victim of Fuller's gag turns out to be a psychotic murderer and soon the brothers are being pursued by the relentless stalker, who gets his revenge in gruesome fashion. Joy Ride, which co-stars Matthew Kimbrough, was produced under the working title "Squelch."

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Young wizard-in-training Harry Potter (Daniel Radcliffe) returns to Hogwarts for his fifth year of studies, only to find that the magical community seems to be in a curious state of denial about his recent encounter with the sinister Lord Voldemort (Ralph Fiennes) in the fifth installment of the popular fantasy film series based on the best-selling books by author J.K. Rowling. Rumor has it that the dreaded Lord Voldemort has returned, but Minister for Magic Cornelius Fudge (Robert Hardy) isn't so sure what to make of all the hearsay currently floating around the campus of Hogwarts. Suspecting that Headmaster Albus Dumbledore (Michael Gambon) may be fueling the rumors regarding Voldemort's return in order to undermine his authority and lay claim to his job, Fudge entrusts newly arrived Defense Against the Dark Arts professor Dolores Umbridge (Imelda Staunton) with the task of tracking Dumbledore and keeping a protective watch over the nervous student body. The young wizards of Hogwarts will need something much more effective than Umbridge's Ministry-approved course in defensive magic if they are to truly succeed in the extraordinary battle that lies ahead, however, and when the administration fails to provide the students with the tools that they will need to defend Hogwarts against the fearsome powers of the Dark Arts, Hermione (Emma Watson), Ron (Rupert Grint), and Harry take it upon themselves to recruit a small group of students to form "Dumbledore's Army" in preparation for the ultimate supernatural showdown

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: Brilliant scientist Reed Richards builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past. This reboot of the iconic Marvel superhero team stars Miles Teller as Richards (who becomes Mr. Fantastic, able to bend and stretch his body into impossible shapes), Michael B. Jordan as Johnny Storm (aka the Human Torch, whose body can erupt in flames), Kate Mara as Sue Storm (aka the Invisible Woman -- no explanation needed), and Jamie Bell as Ben Grimm (who is transformed into the rock monster known as The Thing). Directed by Josh Trank, who previously worked with Jordan on the superhero film Chronicle

programme.title: Before the Rains
programme.desc: An Englishman intent on opening a spice plantation in Kerala attempts to gain the trust of the local villagers and destroys numerous lives in the process in this period drama from director/cinematographer Santosh Sivan. The year is 1937, and the power that the English wield over the citizens of India can be devastating even in the mildest of cases. Henry Moores (Linus Roache) is an entrepreneur and businessman who has singled out Kerala as the site where he plans to break ground on a potentially lucrative spice plantation. When Henry discovers that he will have to build a new road in order to make his plans feasible, he enlists the aid of trusted right-hand man T.K. (Rahul Bose) is warming the locals to the idea. The project is going to take plenty of manpower, and Henry is going to need all the help he can get. But while Henry relies on T.K. to help him realize his professional goals, his personal needs fall on the shoulders of his pretty housekeeper, Sajani (Nandita Das). One day, when their trip into the forest to collect honey takes a decidedly sensual turn, two local village boys witness the erotically charged tryst and word eventually gets back to Sanani's husband in the village(n)

But such was the power of the tobacco company, they threatened a lawsuit which could have put CBS out of business. Mann maintains the tension of the fractious relationships between Wigand, Bergman, the CBS executives, the courts and the tobacco company to raise it to thriller level, with the end always in doubt as Bergman battles for the truth to be told(n)

Musical prodigies both, the Bakers have long been teamed as a twin-piano act, with the less talented Frank (Beau Bridges) coasting on the skills of his brilliant younger brother, Jack (Jeff Bridges). Their career dwindling to nickel-and-dime dates in second-rate clubs, the Bakers decide that they need a female vocalist to boost their popularity. They select auditioner Susie Diamond (Michelle Pfeiffer), who in addition to being a gifted songstress is drop-dead gorgeous. programme.desc: The first film by Duncan Tucker, Transamerica stars Felicity Huffman as a pre-operative transsexual named Bree (whose given name was Stanley). One week before going under the knife, Bree learns that she fathered a boy who is now 17 and is in trouble with the law. Bree would like to ignore this information, but is forced to meet the young man, Toby (played by Kevin Zegers), by her analyst Margaret (Elizabeth Peña), who will not allow the surgery to happen unless Bree meets him and confronts this aspect of her past. Upon meeting, the son believes that Bree is simply a do-gooder. She buys a car and the two road-trip back to her home in Los Angeles, Bree all the while attempting to keep from Toby the truth of the situation

programme.title: Dave Chappelle's Block Party
programme.desc: In September 2004, comedian Dave Chappelle took a break from his immensely successful Comedy Central show to stage a free, unpublicized, all-star hip-hop concert in the Clinton Hill neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY. Inviting fans over the Internet, on the street, and even in his family's hometown of Yellow Springs, OH, Chappelle asked filmmaker Michel Gondry to document the event from its inception on through to the performances themselves. The result is Dave Chappelle's Block Party, a concert film that provides not only a sampling of the music on display that September, but also an intimate look at the comedian himself. Gondry's cameras tag along with Chappelle as he visits Ohio, recruits a university marching band to play at the show, and surveys the opinions of Clinton Hill on the show that's about to take place. Along the way, we're introduced to some the comedian's favorite acts, in rehearsals and on-stage: Dead Prez, Jill Scott, Mos Def, the Roots, Erykah Badu, Kanye West, and the surprise reuniting of the Fugees

But when her egotistical boss takes credit for her work, she leaves the salon with the shampoo girl in tow to open a shop of her own. Gina buys a rundown salon and inherits a motley group of headstrong stylists, a colorful clientele, and a sexy piano-playing electrician. It's a rocky road to fulfilling her dreams, but you can't keep a good woman down(n)

programme.title: Racing Stripes
programme.desc: A horse of a different pattern becomes a spoiler in a high-stakes race in the family-friendly comedy-drama. Nolan Walsh (Bruce Greenwood) is a farmer who once earned his living training racehorses before his wife was killed in an accident while riding, which led him to leave the racing game. Nolan tends to his farm and looks after his daughter Channing (Hayden Panettiere) and a large flock of animals, who speak to one another but not to humans. After a traveling circus passes through town, a zebra pony is left behind; Nolan takes in the animal, intending to return it to the circus, but at Channing's insistence they keep the zebra, naming him Stripes (voiced by Frankie Muniz). Channing loves Stripes, and the zebra is welcomed by the other critters on the farm, including grumpy Shetland pony Tucker (voiced by Dustin Hoffman), slow-moving hound dog Lightning (voiced by Snoop Dogg), a New Jersey-born pelican named Goose (voiced by Joe Pantoliano), skinny-brained rooster Reggie (voiced by Jeff Foxworthy), and deep-thinking goat Franny (voiced by Whoopi Goldberg). Channing discovers that Stripes can outrun nearly any horse around, and Woodzie (M. Emmett Walsh), a local character who has spent years handicapping the ponies, is convinced the zebra would be shoo-in in the Kentucky Open, a prestigious race held at the estate of champion horse breeder Clara Dalrymple (Wendie Malick). Channing believes Stripes can win, but he'll need the help of Nolan, who isn't so sure he's ready to start training again; meanwhile, Stripes gets plenty of advice from the other farm animals about his big step onto the race track. Mandy Moore, David Spade, and Steve Harvey also contribute their voice talents to the picture(n)

programme.title: Shrek
programme.desc: Classic fairy tales get a vigorous working over in this comic, computer-animated fantasy based on the children's book by William Steig. Mike Meyers stars as Shrek, a green ogre who's perfectly content to live alone in a vast swamp, until it's suddenly overrun with refugees such as The Three Bears, Pinocchio, The Seven Dwarves, Cinderella, and many others. It seems that the evil and very short Lord Farquaad (John Lithgow) has ordered the storybook denizens of his realm, Duloc, to be summarily deported. Shrek confronts Farquaad, accompanied by a wisecracking Donkey (Eddie Murphy), and the disgruntled ogre is offered a deal: Farquaad desires to marry Princess Fiona (Cameron Diaz), but she's being held captive by a dragon in a far-off realm. Rescue Fiona and return her to Duloc, and Shrek's swamp will once again be his own. So begins a series of adventures for Shrek and his trusty "steed." Shrek also stars Linda Hunt(n)

programme.title: I Origins
programme.desc: Writer/director Mike Cahill's drama I Origins centers on medical student Ian Gray (Michael Pitt). Ian specializes in the evolution of the human eye. One day he attends a party where he meets a masked woman whose eyes transfix him, and soon the two fall in love. Years later, Ian makes a startling discovery in the lab, forcing him on a trek across the globe in order to uncover profound truths about mankind. I Origins screened at the 2014 Sundance Film Festival

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords

programme.title: Van Helsing
programme.desc: Outcast Van Helsing is charged with a mission to go to the shadowy world of Transylvania and vanquish the evil Count Dracula. He joins forces with a beautiful woman descended from a powerful royal family, but finds that his goal of annihilating the enemy brings him face to face with his own past

programme.title: Deception
programme.desc: Involving, noirish thriller featuring a winning chemistry between Hugh Jackman and Ewan McGregor. Jackman plays a smooth-talking lawyer who introduces McGregor's shy corporate accountant to the wild world of a secretive sex club known as The List, whose motto is "no rough stuff and no names." Unfortunately, McGregor's involvement leads him into a maelstrom of double-crosses, intrigue and murder. Michelle Williams. Directed by Marcel Langenegger. Jackman is also one of the film's producers

programme.title: San Andreas

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: This touching biopic of celebrated physicist Stephen Hawking explores his early years at Cambridge, where he fell in love with liberal-arts student and future wife Jane shortly before being diagnosed with ALS. As the years progress, Jane begins to feel more like a nurse than a spouse, and Hawking develops feelings for a woman who is hired to care for him

programme.title: The Good Shepherd

programme.title: San Andreas

programme.title: Witness
programme.desc: Juárez. A series spotlighting the work of photojournalists in conflict zones around the world begins in Juárez, Mexico, where Eros Hoagland documents the violence and despair associated with drug trafficking, gang violence and law-enforcement agencies. Hoagland's father, Newsweek photographer John Hoagland, was killed in El Salvador in 1984(n)

programme.desc: This darkly funny coming-of-age story boasts an outstanding ensemble cast including Susan Sarandon, Bill Pullman, Claire Danes and Jeff Goldblum. Kieran Culkin stars as Igby, a rich teen who rebels against his dysfunctional family, including a yuppie brother (Ryan Phillippe), a tyrannical mother and a mentally ill father. Amanda Peet, Jared Harris(n)

programme.title: Tenacious D in The Pick of Destiny
programme.desc: Jack Black and Kyle Gass star as JB and KG (a.k.a. Tenacious D), two rock guitarists on a mission to become the greatest musicians in the world. All they need is a guitar pick made from Satan's tooth. On this loose premise, Liam Lynch's film, written by Black and Gass, is an excuse for the two actors to indulge in every rock joke going. The film mixes their live act, with suitably outré lyrics, with set pieces including a car chase to rival The Dukes of Hazzard and a chance to see JB doing cock push-ups. The supporting cast include Meatloaf as JB's disapproving father and, in cameos, Ben Stiller, Tim Robbins and David Grohl of Nirvana and the Foo Fighters as the devil himself(n)

programme.title: The Girl
programme.desc: Alfred Hitchcock was at the height of his fame and creativity when, in 1962, he chose an unknown fashion model to star in his most ambitious film, The Birds. But as he sculpted Tippi Hedren into the perfect Hitchcock blonde of his imagination, he became obsessed with the impossible dream of winning the real woman's love. His failure destroyed both of their careers. Screenwriter Gwyneth Hughes has interviewed Tippi Hedren and surviving members of Hitchcock's crew. This film tells their full tragic story(r)

programme.title: Schindler's List

programme.title: Red Army
programme.desc: A look at the Soviet Union's national hockey team and their decades of success in the sport. The filmmakers also profile superstar player Slava Fetisov, who turned to politics after his hockey career. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
